title: Would someone from Mozilla please tell me why I get the following message  "Your browser is being managed by your organization" Who is my "organziation"? Thank you.
content:
Good Morning. Would someone from Mozilla please tell me why I get the following message "Your browser is being managed by your organization" Who is my "organization"? Have I been hacked?

Thank you.
creator: annfhapp

title: How to open lost firefox windows
content: my firefox crashed and my main window disappeared, and when i check my history it wasnt there

title: cookies
content: I can't watch TV online because when I sign in it says that my browser has cookies disabled. This is not true. What do I do?
creator: brushofgang

title: Firefox up-grades
content: Firefox up-grades always reset my preferences settings presumably to a Firefox default condition. I then have to reset them back to where I want them. Can I stop this happening?
creator: jim_mci

title: Recovering 8 yrs of Research/ Lost Bookmarks & Tabs
content:
My computer crashed 10 days ago- & my Firefox browser disappeared along with several on screen folders

When I started checking for a reason, the only thing I found, was that my C Drive was almost out of memory

When I re-loaded Firfow, 8 years of Research tabs/ bookmarks were gone... Can you help 

                                C Crow
creator: CRichardCrow

title: Your browser is being managed by your organization
content: I can delete Mozilla HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\ and its gone as long as I don't reboot my computer, other wise its back again. I really don't understand the part stating who is managing by whom is this organization? I've been a long time user of Firefox so I would like to have this issue resolved as this my second attempt. I downloaded this file suggested by a member called policy_templates_v4.12.zip but at 73 years old and reading this nonsense imho is just not right. If I can't get this resolved soon I shall change browsers and it won't be Chrome that is for sure. I started with computers back 1989 long before the internet came along so due to bad health issues my memory is at best not great. Thanks for reading this and hopefully I can get an answer that will satisfy me as I love Firefox and really don't want to give up on it.
creator: hemi426

title: Wasted Space
content: I just upgraded from 88.1.0 to 114.0.2, and regret it. How do I reduce the wasted space? The search bar, menu bar, etc. And how do I get rid of the double spacing in my bookmarks & history? So much wasted space.
creator: mnosera

title: Stripe Payment Gateway
content: We use stripe as our payment processor on our website when collecting donations (https://effectivealtruism.org.au/). As of a couple of days ago, we are having multiple customers receiving the below error when they try to submit their payment (after entering all card details and completing the captcha). Stripe have advised that the issue is related to 3DS with our customers bank accounts. However, we think we have identified that this problem is actually related to customers using the Firefox browser. We have been able to process test donations with no issues using chrome but receive the same error using Firefox with the same card details.
creator: megan.goodwin

title: Read the message
content:
Hallo,

I quit with your browser and go for your competitors. The reasons are: 1) not easy to find support 2) automatized so called "help" is just time consuming and of no use 3) no way how to set things by myself or very hard to find

I need reliable browser, where I can find solutions quickly, not a stupid browser, who is behaving differently on different computers with no reliable support.

Also I hate demands to fill in headings etc. Time consuming bullshit.
creator: stepanp

title: "Access Denied"
content: Recently I have received msgs. indicating Firefox is not allowing me access to sites/accounts I should be able to access legitimately -- such as airline accounts, Xfinity, etc. where I have already established accounts (log-ins & passwords). Here's an example of a msg. I get: "You don't have permission to access "http://www.aa.com/loyalty/updatePasswordSubmit" on this server. Reference #18.54f4d517.1688084550.13db3e" -- when trying to sign in to my American Airlines account (which wanted me to update my password). The same happens when I try to view my Xfinity bill. Any idea of what's causing this problem?
creator: snraann

title: CAN NOT SIGN IN
content: Can not sign into https://streamtv.directv.com/ last 6 days says: Something's gone wrong We may be having trouble with your connection. Connecting your device to Wi-Fi could help fix the issue or try again later. If you were using an app, close this page. Otherwise, start over. i CAN SIGN IN MICROSOFT EDGE OK. gary
